job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for an adept Linux engineer to help our organisation (and our developers) build and professionalise our Linux environment.

   You will also be involved in:

   - Modelling CI/CD deployment

   - Writing and managing Puppet roles and Ansible playbooks

   - Acting in a DevOps team (together with other developers, a product owner, scrum master and QA Engineer)

   As a Linux engineer, you will be responsible for:

   - Creating designs and models

   - Retrieving user needs / problem statements

   - Detailing the functional requirements and user stories into various deliverables.

   - Taking more junior Linux engineers on board and training them.

   - Contributing to the functional testing of delivered software.

   - Evaluating designs with key users, stakeholders and end users.

   In addition, you deliver:

   - (Detail) designs (depending on the assignment ranging from wireframe to interactive prototype)

   - Automation and patching in AWX

   - Automation and implementation of RHEL, RedHat, IPA, Ansible, Puppet, VMWare, NSX-T LVM, PKI, NFS

   From your role as Linux engineer, you communicate frequently and frequently with:

   - With the PO, key users, stakeholders and end users about functional requirements and user stories

   - With the Teamlead about the functional content, usability and progress of the work package and about test results.
job_details.full_text:
Senior Linux Engineer

We are looking for an adept Linux engineer to help our organisation (and our developers) build and professionalise our Linux environment.

   You will also be involved in:

   - Modelling CI/CD deployment

   - Writing and managing Puppet roles and Ansible playbooks

   - Acting in a DevOps team (together with other developers, a product owner, scrum master and QA Engineer)

   As a Linux engineer, you will be responsible for:

   - Creating designs and models

   - Retrieving user needs / problem statements

   - Detailing the functional requirements and user stories into various deliverables.

   - Taking more junior Linux engineers on board and training them.

   - Contributing to the functional testing of delivered software.

   - Evaluating designs with key users, stakeholders and end users.

   In addition, you deliver:

   - (Detail) designs (depending on the assignment ranging from wireframe to interactive prototype)

   - Automation and patching in AWX

   - Automation and implementation of RHEL, RedHat, IPA, Ansible, Puppet, VMWare, NSX-T LVM, PKI, NFS

   From your role as Linux engineer, you communicate frequently and frequently with:

   - With the PO, key users, stakeholders and end users about functional requirements and user stories

   - With the Teamlead about the functional content, usability and progress of the work package and about test results.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on Linux system administration, CI/CD, and traditional DevOps practices, with no mention of AI, machine learning, or generative models. The tasks described, such as managing Linux environments, writing configuration management scripts (Puppet, Ansible), and functional testing, do not align with the core responsibilities of an ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer. The mention of 'Modelling CI/CD deployment' and 'Creating designs and models' appears to refer to system architecture and deployment pipelines, not AI/ML models. Therefore, it is not an AI-related technical role.

job_tasks.justification: The job involves managing CI/CD deployment, writing and managing Puppet roles and Ansible playbooks, and automation and patching in AWX, which are all core MLOps activities.
Writing and managing Puppet roles and Ansible playbooks are key tasks in configuration management and automation, which fall under MLOps.
job_tasks.phrase: Writing and managing Puppet roles and Ansible playbooks

job_tasks.justification: Acting within a DevOps team is directly related to the principles and practices of Operations Engineering.
Retrieving user needs and problem statements is a fundamental aspect of understanding the business context and translating it into technical requirements.
Detailing functional requirements and user stories is part of translating business needs into technical specifications.
job_tasks.phrase: Detailing the functional requirements and user stories into various deliverables.

job_tasks.justification: Contributing to the functional testing of delivered software is a part of the software development lifecycle, ensuring quality and functionality.
job_tasks.phrase: Contributing to the functional testing of delivered software.

job_tasks.justification: Evaluating designs with key users, stakeholders, and end users is crucial for aligning technical solutions with business needs and gathering feedback.
job_tasks.phrase: Evaluating designs with key users, stakeholders and end users.

job_tasks.justification: Creating designs and models, and delivering (Detail) designs, including interactive prototypes, relates to the software development process.
Automation and patching in AWX are direct MLOps tasks for managing and maintaining systems.

Automation and implementation of RHEL, RedHat, IPA, Ansible, Puppet, VMWare, NSX-T LVM, PKI, NFS are all related to system administration and infrastructure management, falling under Operations Engineering.
job_tasks.phrase: Automation and implementation of RHEL, RedHat, IPA, Ansible, Puppet, VMWare, NSX-T LVM, PKI, NFS

job_tasks.justification: Communicating about functional requirements and user stories with PO, key users, stakeholders, and end users is essential for business understanding and alignment.
job_tasks.phrase: With the PO, key users, stakeholders and end users about functional requirements and user stories

job_tasks.justification: Communicating about the functional content, usability and progress, and test results with the Teamlead is part of understanding and managing the business/project context.
job_tasks.phrase: With the Teamlead about the functional content, usability and progress of the work package and about test results.
